answers.answer: When the doctor broke my water, it w as very unpleasant.  The contractions came faster and more painful.  Everyone is different tho

Went to the hospital with symptoms of preeclampsia,  got diagnosed with it and then proceeded an unplanned induction. The first thing they did was give me a round of antibiotics through an IV drip. About an hour later they started the oxytocin drip on me. The first 8 hours wasn't bad. I had mild contractions but I wasn't progressing so they put a balloon cathedar inside my cervix. It hurt really really bad. Every movement I made caused me to have terrible cramping. It took me 6 hours to push the balloon through my cervix and then I was 5cm dilated. I waited a few more hours and got checked again, no progress so they broke my water with a medical tool. It was a huge gush of warm water and then I continued to leak for a few hours. They upped my oxytocin /pitocin drip and I started having terribly painful contractions. I contracted for and long time before they gave me the epidural. After the epidural I felt great but my blood pressure was rising and my baby was having irregular heart tones. After 30+ hours of induction my doctor told me I needed a c section :(
Oh blimey that is y they induceing me becs I have pre eclampsia symptoms im so scared im 37 weeks 5days

I was 36 weeks 2 days when I got induced last Friday. When they started the induction I was only 1 cm dilated and 60% effaced. I don't know if that's why I didn't progress but the induction definitely failed for me my body wasn't ready and didn't want to be forced.
Have u had baby now then
Yes they gave me a c section last Friday I spent 7 total days in the hospital
